rules: Rule1: Provided that pollution in the area increased, the ecosystem in the region is not stable.
Rule2: Pollution in the area increased or the region is impacted by climate change.
Rule3: Whenever the region is impacted by climate change, the ecosystem in the region is not stable.
Rule4: If the agency funded conservation technology, then DNA sequencing for the species is completed.
Rule5: Provided that genetic diversity in the population is analyzed, the conservation project is successful.

Rule6: Under the condition that government funding for the budget is approved, then if a research team of scientists is assembled, then whenever DNA sequencing for the species is completed, genetic diversity in the population is analyzed.

Rule7: If the organization received a private donation, then if a research team of scientists is assembled, then whenever DNA sequencing for the species is completed, genetic diversity in the population is analyzed.
Rule8: Whenever the environmental ministry supported the project, government funding for the budget is approved.
Rule9: Either the environmental ministry supported the project or the philanthropic foundation funded the research.
Rule10: Provided that the philanthropic foundation funded the research, the organization received a private donation.
Rule11: Under the condition that population growth for the species is observed, the breeding program in captivity is successful.
Rule12: Provided that wild reintroduction for the species worked, the population of the species recovered.
Rule13: If veterinary care is provided to the animals, then if the breeding program in captivity is successful, wild reintroduction for the species worked.
Rule14: If artificial insemination is used in breeding, then fertility treatment is applied to the individuals.
Rule15: Either artificial insemination is used in breeding or natural breeding occurred in the population.
Rule16: Provided that natural breeding occurred in the population, the conservation project is successful.
Rule17: If offspring are produced in the generation, then the conservation project is successful.
Rule18: Provided that the committee approved the cloning project, genetic material for the species is available.

Rule19: Climate conditions in the habitat are favorable or either the mating season in the environment is optimal or if fertility treatment is applied to the individuals, then offspring are produced in the generation.
Rule20: If the review board accepted the research proposal, then funding for the project is secured.
Rule21: Either the authority granted regulatory approval or it is not the case that the committee raised ethical concerns.
Rule22: Under the condition that safety protocols are established in the laboratory, it is not the case that the authority granted regulatory approval.
Rule23: Whenever the facility met the biosafety level, safety protocols are established in the laboratory.
Rule24: Either the facility met the biosafety level or inspectors verified the containment procedures.
Rule25: Provided that inspectors verified the containment procedures, safety protocols are established in the laboratory.
Rule26: Either the study assessed the environmental impact or experts completed the risk analysis.
Rule27: Whenever experts completed the risk analysis, it is not the case that opponents filed a legal challenge.

Rule28: If the conservation plan is implemented as a strategy, then stakeholder consultation is conducted through meetings or if the study assessed the environmental impact, then it is not the case that opponents filed a legal challenge.
Rule29: Provided that the government agency executed the program, the conservation plan is implemented as a strategy.
Rule30: Either the government agency executed the program or an NGO partnership is formed as an alliance.
Rule31: Under the condition that an NGO partnership is formed as an alliance, the conservation plan is implemented as a strategy.
Rule32: If captive breeding is started at the facility, then genetic management is initiated in the program.
Rule33: Whenever population monitoring is established as a system, the species is extinct.
Rule34: If conflicting data is reported from sources, then research findings are consistent across results.
Rule35: Provided that conflicting data is reported from sources, it is not the case that research findings are consistent across results.
Rule36: Whenever genetic material for the species is available, funding for the project is secured.
Rule37: If the traditional conservation approach is preferred, then the group opposed biotechnology.
Rule38: Either the traditional conservation approach is preferred or the habitat in the area is destroyed.
Rule39: If the research achieved journal publication, then if the study passed peer review, it is not the case that the technique is controversial in its methodology.
Rule40: Provided that the clinical trial for the vaccine is completed, then if a vaccine for the disease is developed, the conservation project is successful.
Rule41: Whenever the experimental design of the study is flawed, the results of the experiment are reproducible.
Rule42: Either the experimental design of the study is flawed or the clinical trial for the vaccine is completed.
Rule43: Under the condition that the data lacks statistical significance, it is not the case that the results of the experiment are reproducible.
Rule44: Provided that the alternative strategy is adopted, the research team changed its direction.
Rule45: If disease resistance in the species is enhanced, then whenever DNA sequencing for the species is completed, the conservation project is successful.
Rule46: If gene editing technology is applied, then CRISPR technology is implemented in the procedure.
Rule47: Either gene editing technology is applied or selective breeding is used as a method.
Rule48: Under the condition that selective breeding is used as a method, disease resistance in the species is enhanced.
Rule49: If CRISPR technology is implemented in the procedure, then molecular tools are developed as techniques.
Rule50: Whenever molecular tools are developed as techniques, disease resistance in the species is enhanced.
Rule51: Under the condition that the field test for the vaccine was successful, then if a vaccine for the disease is developed, the conservation project is successful.
Rule52: Provided that the habitat in the area is destroyed, it is not the case that the vaccination program for the species failed.
Rule53: Whenever it is not the case that either the species is endangered or the conservation project is successful, captive breeding is started at the facility.
Rule54: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the species is endangered or the conservation project is successful, it is not the case that the species is extinct.

Rule55: Provided that it is not the case that if a research team of scientists is assembled, then whenever DNA sequencing for the species is completed, genetic diversity in the population is analyzed, then the alternative strategy is adopted.
Rule56: Whenever it is not the case that if the committee approved the cloning project, then the review board accepted the research proposal, the committee raised ethical concerns.

Rule57: Under the condition that it is not the case that if public support is obtained from the community, then it is not the case that the committee approved the cloning project, opponents filed a legal challenge.
Rule58: If it is not the case that if genetic management is initiated in the program, then population monitoring is established as a system, then conflicting data is reported from sources.

Rule59: Provided that it is not the case that the scientific community reached a consensus or it is not the case that the group opposed biotechnology, the technique is controversial in its methodology.

Rule60: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the species is endangered or the conservation project is successful, then the species is extinct, the committee approved the cloning project.
Rule61: If it is not the case that the field test for the vaccine was successful, then the vaccination program for the species failed.
Rule62: Provided that it is not the case that the habitat in the area is destroyed, the ecosystem in the region is stable.
Rule63: If it is not the case that the conservation project is successful, then population growth for the species is observed.
Rule64: Under the condition that it is not the case that the conservation project is successful, it is not the case that the population of the species recovered.
facts: Fact1: The agency funded conservation technology.
Fact2: A research team of scientists is assembled.
Fact3: Veterinary care is provided to the animals.
Fact4: Public support is obtained from the community.
Fact5: The study passed peer review.
Fact6: The research achieved journal publication.
Fact7: A vaccine for the disease is developed.
Fact8: The data lacks statistical significance.
Fact9: It is not the case that the species is endangered.
Fact10: It is not the case that the mating season in the environment is optimal.
Fact11: It is not the case that climate conditions in the habitat are favorable.
Fact12: It is not the case that funding for the project is secured.
Fact13: It is not the case that stakeholder consultation is conducted through meetings.
Fact14: It is not the case that the scientific community reached a consensus.
Fact15: It is not the case that the research team changed its direction.
